intro: Drimia fugax, commonly known as the transient lily, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Asparagaceae family and is characterized by its slender, grass-like leaves and bell-shaped flowers. The plant is typically found in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun. Drimia fugax is known for its short blooming period, often appearing only for a brief time before disappearing, hence its common name. Its botanical features make it a unique and rare addition to the flora of its native habitat.
